segments.text: As I look at the chaotic scene, a part of me wants to laugh; the children are so mischievous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But I also feel a deep sense of worry brewing in my stomach as I watch the boy climb higher.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The puddle of water is growing, creeping closer to the edge of calamity.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s strange how the outside world looks so peaceful through that window.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Here, inside, it’s like a waiting game for something to go wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but feel disgusted at how careless the woman is, leaving them to their mischief.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Will she ever notice, or is she too lost in her own routine to care?
segments.speaker: PAR
